intro: Eriocaulon longicuspe var. zeylanicum, commonly known as the Zeylanic spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and compact inflorescences that bear small, spike-like clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and supporting aquatic biodiversity.
